Reason: The 'flush_compression' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. When compression is enabled during flush operations, it can affect the execution time and memory consumption of the system. Disabling compression may lead to faster flush operations and reduced memory usage, while enabling compression may increase execution time and memory consumption. Therefore, the 'flush_compression' configuration has a notable effect on system performance, making it performance-sensitive.
